Corkscrew as a screwdriver: A corkscrew can be used as a screwdriver for small screws, as the spiral can help to grip the screw head.
Corkscrew as a door stop: A corkscrew can be used to hold open a door by inserting the sharp end into the door hinge.
Corkscrew as a paperweight: A corkscrew can be used to hold down papers on a desk, preventing them from being blown away by the wind.
Corkscrew as a coat hanger: A corkscrew can be used to hang coats by attaching the sharp end to the coat hanger and the spiral to the coat.
Corkscrew as a plant label: A corkscrew can be used as a plant label by writing the name of the plant on the foil and sticking it into the soil.
